page.title: 04FISHING:GEOLOGY - ARRAN
page.content:
{FRESH WATER FISHING: }The rivers in Arran afford many opportunities of a catch of brown trout, sea trout and the occasional salmon from early to mid July onwards. Permits can be obtained from the Tourist Information Centre in Brodick and the charge for a day's fishing in the Rosa Burn would be Â£1.50.
{GEOLOGY:} Arran is a wonderful area for geological studies. Visitors arrive to do field work from schools, colleges and clubs all over the British Isles. Sandstones are found mainly in this area. Agates occur in these rocks and they can be collected on the raised beach at Brodick.
